_comment: Dialogue lines for prop interactions, organized by prop type

carl: It's our couch. Paul sometimes hides things in the cushions.
paul: The couch! Perfect for afternoon naps. And hiding snacks.
horror: There's something sticky between the cushions...

carl: A perfectly normal table. At least it was before Paul got here.
paul: Great for board games! Or... other activities.
horror: Are those scratch marks? From fingernails?

carl: The lamp still works. Surprisingly, Paul hasn't destroyed it yet.
paul: I love lamps! They're like little indoor suns.
horror: Why does the light flicker whenever Carl walks by?

carl: My book collection. Paul keeps putting weird things between the pages.
paul: Books! Full of ideas. Some good, some... inspiring.
horror: One of these books is bound in something that isn't leather...

carl: The kitchen counter. I try to keep it clean. TRY.
paul: So many delicious meals have been prepared here!
horror: The stains won't come out. They never come out.

carl: I'm afraid to look inside.
paul: The fridge! Full of... ingredients. Fresh ingredients.
horror: Something in there is still moving.

carl: The stove. Paul has been 'cooking' again.
paul: My culinary laboratory! The flavors I've discovered...
horror: That's not food residue. That's not food.

carl: My bed. The only safe place. Usually.
paul: Sleep is so peaceful. Unless you dream about Carl.
horror: Something was under here recently. It left a trail.

carl: My dresser. Paul, STAY OUT OF MY DRAWERS.
paul: Drawers full of possibilities!
horror: Why are all my socks missing their pairs?

carl: Just a nightstand. Nothing unusual. Please.
paul: I keep my midnight snacks here!
horror: The drawer won't close all the way. Something's blocking it.

carl: I don't want to know what Paul has done to this.
paul: The thinking throne!
horror: The water hasn't been that color in days.

carl: The bathtub. Ring around the... is that a ring or a stain?
paul: Perfect for relaxing! Or... other purposes.
horror: The drain is clogged. With something fibrous.

carl: A storage chest. I should check what's inside.
paul: Treasure chest! Well, more like 'trophy' chest.
horror: It's locked. And warm to the touch.

carl: A wooden crate. Probably full of normal things.
paul: I've been saving some special items in here!
horror: Something inside is scratching to get out.

carl: An old barrel. What's that smell?
paul: Barrels are great for storage! And other things.
horror: The lid is sealed shut. With wax. Red wax.

carl: My desk. I do my work here. When Paul lets me.
paul: Planning desk! So many plans...
horror: The papers are covered in drawings. Of hands.

carl: A support pillar. Structurally important.
paul: Pillars! They hold things up. Unlike some people.
horror: There are grooves worn into the stone. Like claw marks.

carl: A chair. At least this is normal.
paul: Chairs are for sitting! Or standing on. Or...
horror: The seat is slightly warm. Someone was just here.

carl: PAUL. What is that. What IS that.
paul: Oh that? That's from my art project. Finger painting!
horror: It's still wet. And spreading.

carl: The curtain is destroyed. Was that you, Paul?
paul: I needed fabric for a project! Curtains are basically just big napkins.
horror: Something tore through this from the other side.

carl: Seven years of bad luck. As if living with Paul wasn't enough.
paul: I didn't like what it was showing me. So I fixed it!
horror: Your reflection is still moving even though you stopped.

carl: This plant died. Everything dies around Paul eventually.
paul: I was feeding it! I just used... alternative nutrients.
horror: The soil is moving. Something is growing, but it isn't a plant.

carl: I'm not opening that. I'm NOT opening that.
paul: That's my special delivery! Don't worry about the smell.
horror: It's humming. Boxes don't hum.

carl: The sink. At least the water still-- why is it red?
paul: Great for washing up! And washing... things... off.
horror: Hair is growing out of the drain. Long, dark hair.

carl: I don't want to know what Paul has thrown away in there.
paul: One man's trash is another man's treasure! Or evidence.
horror: Something in there just blinked.

carl: A rug. It really ties the room together. Wait, what's under it?
paul: I picked this rug! The pattern hides stains wonderfully.
horror: There's a lump under the rug. A large, person-shaped lump.

carl: One of Paul's paintings. I wish I could un-see it.
paul: My masterpiece! I call it 'Tuesday Afternoon'. The red is very authentic.
horror: The eyes in the painting follow you. All forty of them.

carl: A curtain. Keeping the outside world blissfully unaware.
paul: Curtains are great! They keep the neighbors from seeing my projects.
horror: There's a silhouette behind the curtain. It isn't yours.

carl: A cabinet. Locked. Why is it locked, Paul?
paul: My supply cabinet! Very organized. By category and freshness date.
horror: Something inside is knocking. Rhythmically. Patiently.

carl: I stopped using this wardrobe after I found what Paul hid in there.
paul: So much storage space! You can fit almost anything in here. Almost anyone.
horror: The door creaks open by itself at 3 AM. Every night.

carl: The TV hasn't worked since the 'incident'.
paul: Sometimes I see things on the screen. Even when it's off! Fun!
horror: The screen is showing this room. From an angle that doesn't exist.

carl: Same as the fridge. I'm still afraid to look inside.
paul: So many ingredients! All locally sourced, if you know what I mean.
horror: The temperature display reads 98.6 degrees. Body temperature.

carl: A stool. Simple. Uncomplicated. Unlike my life.
paul: I love stools! Perfect height for all sorts of activities.
horror: There are deep gouge marks on the legs. From something dragging it.

carl: A plant. Still alive somehow, despite Paul's 'care'.
paul: I talk to the plants! They're great listeners. Unlike some llamas.
horror: It turned toward you when you walked in. Plants don't do that.

carl: The tub. I haven't used it since I found Paul's 'bath bombs'.
paul: Nothing like a relaxing soak! The fizzy red ones are my favorite.
horror: The drain gurgles when no one is using it. Words. It gurgles words.

carl: It's a {propType}. Nothing unusual.
paul: A {propType}! How delightful!
